{
    "number": 192612,
    "data": "1,2,3,11,17,19,139,251,307,379,587",
    "name": "Monotonic ordering of set S generated by these rules:  if x and y are in S and x^2+2y^2 is a prime, then x^2+2y^2 is in S, and 1 and 2 are in S.",
    "comment": [
        "See the discussions at A192476 and A192580.  The start-set for A192612 is {1,2}.  For results using start-sets {1}, and {1,2,4}, see A192598 and A192613."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "start = {1, 2}; primes = Table[Prime[n], {n, 1, 20000}];",
        "f[x_, y_] := If[MemberQ[primes, x^2 + 2 y^2], x^2 + 2 y^2]",
        "b[x_] :=",
        "  Block[{w = x},",
        "   Select[Union[",
        "     Flatten[AppendTo[w,",
        "       Table[f[w[[i]], w[[j]]], {i, 1, Length[w]}, {j, 1,",
        "         Length[w]}]]]], # < 30000 &]];",
        "t = FixedPoint[b, start]  (* A192612 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A192476, A192580, A192613."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,full,fini",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, Jul 05 2011",
    "references": 3,
    "revision": 5,
    "time": "2012-03-30T18:57:36-04:00",
    "created": "2011-07-06T13:17:12-04:00"
}
